channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Private Equity: In Essence, Plunder?
item.description: To understand what private equity is at its worst is a call to action, personally and professionally.

item.title: Elon Musk tries one more time to save his $56 billion pay package
item.description: If the judge sticks with her earlier ruling, Musk can finally appeal the decision to the Delaware Supreme Court.

item.title: Small Caps, Large Caps, and Interest Rates
item.description: The relationship between stocks and interest rates is not reliably stable. There are periods when equities are highly rate sensitive, and periods when they aren't.

item.title: Coca-Cola will pay IRS $6 billion in back taxes while appealing federal court’s decision
item.description: Coca-Cola accused the IRS of changing how it let the company calculate U.S. income based on profits amounting to more than $9 billion from foreign licensees and affiliates.

item.title: How Well Does the Market Predict Volatility?
item.description: How accurate is VIX on a realized basis and when does it diverge with the market?

item.title: Elon Musk says a person with a Neuralink chip could beat a pro gamer in a few years
item.description: "We feel pretty confident that in the next year or two, someone with a Neuralink implant would be able to outperform a pro gamer because the reaction time would be faster."

item.title: What Do Experts Really Know? Embracing the Unknown
item.description: Confidence is a necessary but insufficient factor in long-term investing success. Raising the metaknowledge quotient of the investment team can help protect against the surprises that lurk in left-tail events and remain unknown, until they’re known.

item.title: Trump pulls out of ABC presidential debate with Harris and seeks Fox News face-off
item.description: In a series of Truth Social posts, Trump said his agreement to a Sept. 10 debate on ABC “has been terminated” because he will no longer face Democratic President Joe Biden.

item.title: Investment Manager Selection Is Hotting Up. Are You Ready for the Tough Questions?
item.description: Investment managers are being caught off guard by tougher questions from an increasingly sophisticated allocator market. Are you prepared for your next beauty parade?

item.title: Trump says Mark Zuckerberg called to apologize about photo of assassination attempt and vowed not to endorse a Democrat
item.description: "Mark’s already been public about the fact that he’s not endorsing either candidate, just as he hasn’t in prior elections," a Meta spokesman said.
